ã€ŒBREAKING NEWS: New development on BNO re Right of Abode for CUKCs.
The Chair of BNO Community of Hong Kong Watch thanks Steve Double MP for his invaluable support. BNO passport holders who were (Citizens of the UK and Colonies) CUKCs will regain their full rights as CUKCs. Congratulations!

The Chair of BNO Community and Hong Kong Watch co-founder Aileen Calverley would like to thank Steve Double MP for delivering the House of Common petition on behalf of our BNO community, communicating with the Home office constantly and fighting for the extension of rights of BNO. replies.msg: Your parents were CUKC. Your parents didn't need to apply for CUKC passports to prove they were CUKC. Except for the period of World War 2, people in the UK have been asked to apply for any form of photo ID (e.g. passport, ID card...). To prove your parents' CUKC, their birth certificates (plus BDTC passport) should be enough.
You wouldn't see "CUKC" on any birth certificates....What your nationality was at the time when you were born was defined in the relevant laws/Acts.

Citizen of the UK and colonizs (CUKC)

A citizen of the UK and colonies was the old colonial status given to British citizens during the period 1 January 1949 to 31 December 1982. Before 1949, British citizens were called British subjects and in the modern day are referred to as British citizens.
